senses.sense_definition: A third name used by Ancient Romans to identify a specific branch of a family or as a personal epithet.

examples.text: The general was best known by his <w>cognomen</w> rather than his clan name.
In Roman society, a <w>cognomen</w> often originated as a description of a physical trait.

senses.sense_definition: A nickname or descriptive name given to a person.

examples.text: Because of his incredible speed, he earned the <w>cognomen</w> "Lightning".
The writer published his controversial essays under a humorous <w>cognomen</w>.
Please write your full <w>cognomen</w> clearly on the legal document.
The registry listed his <w>cognomen</w> as Smith.
